name: White Oyster Mushroom
description: White Oyster mushrooms are easily cultivated and have vigorous mycelium growth. They grow in large clusters and have the typical shelf-like shape of the Pleurotus species. White Oysters have milky white caps with a silky surface, and grow best outdoors on beech, hornbeam, birch, or poplar tree wood. They have a thick, meaty flesh that is milder in flavor than shiitake.
sowing_method: Inoculate wood substrate with grain or plug spawn
